Barry Allen arrives at Iron Heights Penitentiary to investigate his fathers escape. There he over hears Elijah, the guard that helped Henry Allen and his cellmates escape, tell his boss that he had no idea how the prisoners escaped. Barry then gets spotted by Iris, who tells him she is now on the Flash Beat at the paper.

Across town at the Central City Distribution Center for Medi-Barn Supplies, Henry, Mogul, Grinder and Black Mold are robbing the facility of medical supplies. Zoom shows up and pulls the alarm and a guard shows up. Zoom then uses his super-speed to force Henry to pull gun and shoot the guard. The group of escapees make a break for it.

Then, in Keystone City, on the wrong side of the tracks, Grinder goes to see his granny. That is where The Flash finds him and the pair fight it out. The Flash is able to trick Grinder into a magnet trap, and there Grinder reveals that Henry was the leader behind the escape.

Later at a Central City Suburbs, Elijah goes home to his wife, who is dying of cancer. This is where the Flash finds him and Elijah admits to helping Henry escape. The Flash agrees not to turn him if he helps him find Henry. After leaving Elijah's house the Flash is confronted by Professor Zoom who leads him to his old home.
2015-01-01|2015-12-30.name: Blood Is Thicker

The world has been remade and the realms of man and god are separate. With the slaughter of gods fighting daily, being reaped, and set back to combat, all seems truly futile. And those tales may spell doom for the peace that has divided the two realms in new creation.

It’s true, there’s a new Batman in town! You can find out who it is in the all-action issue of Batman! Meanwhile, with his father gone, Damian aka Robin embarks on a dangerous journey. And in the ongoing Batman Eternal, events in Gotham spiral even further out of control!

LOOK BACK ON AN INCREDIBLE YEAR FOR DOCTOR WHO, WITH THE 2016 YEARBOOK!

The 100-page Doctor Who Magazine Yearbook 2016 is packed with all-new material, including exclusive interviews with stars Michelle Gomez (Missy), Ingrid Oliver (Osgood), showrunner Steven Moffat, writers Mark Gatiss and Sarah Dollard, producer Derek Ritchie and directors Daniel O’Hara and Edward Bazalgette.

Elsewhere in this issue, Peter Capaldi shares his memories of an extraordinary photoshoot on Abbey Road, we go behind the scenes at November’s Doctor Who Festival and pay tribute to the Doctor Who luminaries who passed away in 2015.

“Peter Capaldi’s second series contains some of the greatest moments in the show’s history, but we’ve also explored many other corners of the Doctor Who universe,” says editor Marcus Hearn. “We’ve included as much as we can from a diverse year – everything from The Underwater Menace to Doctor Who: The Fan Show.”
2015-01-01|2015-12-30.name: The 2016 Yearbook
